body_html:
Passing is_training=False during inference messes up the output for the resnet_v1 model. Tried doing
with slim.arg_scope(resnet_v2.resnet_arg_scope(is_training)): but getting

with slim.arg_scope(resnet_arg_scope(is_training)): NameError: name 'is_training' is not defined

How exactly does one go about passing the is_training parameter to the model ? BTW, will a pre-trained checkpoint be released for resnet_v2?

 with slim.arg_scope(resnet_arg_scope(is_training)): NameError: name 'is_training' is not defined

body:
Passing `is_training=False` during inference messes up the output for the resnet_v1 model. Tried doing 
`with slim.arg_scope(resnet_v2.resnet_arg_scope(is_training)):`  but getting


` with slim.arg_scope(resnet_arg_scope(is_training)):
NameError: name 'is_training' is not defined`

How exactly does one go about passing the `is_training` parameter to the model ? BTW, will a pre-trained checkpoint be released for resnet_v2?
